hackathon-description-text: CODEX is a community of people who want to imagine the future of books and reading. Programmers, designers, writers, librarians, publishers, readers, bookstore wanderers, literary dreamers—all are welcome.
hackathon-eligibility: CODEX is a community of people who want to imagine the future of books and reading. Programmers, designers, writers, librarians, publishers, readers, bookstore wanderers, literary dreamers—all are welcome.
hackathon-requirements: Anything innovative around books, reading, libraries and literature. Let your imagination roam.
hackathon-rules:
Everyone wins. This is not competitive. We have lovely book schwag from 
, 
, 
 and Macmillan.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Look at lovely book schwag at outofprintclothing.com
Litographs tshirts and tote bags. Look at litographs.com
Books! Recent ones and galleys from Harvard Book Store and Macmillan.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Books from Harvard Book Store and Macmillan

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=75 Amherst St, Cambridge, MA 02142, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: We are looking for anything collaborative and celebratory that demonstrates a love of books, reading, literature and libraries. Remember everyone wins with book schwag.

hackathon-description-header: Innovating about books, libraries, reading and literature.
